entry.title: R: my own function to generate text code for figure
entry.content:
This topic belongs to the reproducable research topic. Sweave is actually a good way of combining R and Latex. However sometime we just need to generate a .tex file so that we can input into main .tex file.

Here is my way:

print.figure <- function(writeto,filename,placement="H",caption,label) { sink(writeto) cat("\\begin{figure}[",placement,"]\n",sep="") cat("\\begin{center}\n",sep="") cat("\\includegraphics{",filename,"}\n",sep="") cat("\\end{center}\n",sep="") if(!missing(caption)) {cat("\\caption{", caption,"}\n",sep="")} if(!missing(label)) {cat("\\label{", label,"}\n",sep="")} cat("\\end{figure}\n",sep="") sink() system(paste("cat",writeto)) }
